intro: Castilleja pseudohyperborea, commonly known as the Sierra larkspur, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Castilleja pseudohyperborea relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an ecologically significant component of its ecosystem.
